title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored an insurance goal in the Bruins' 5-3 win over the Maple Leafs on November 8, 2025.
Minten, traded from Toronto, scored his third goal of the season during his first return to face the Maple Leafs.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm praised Minten as 'the best player on the ice' after the game in Toronto.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara and Joe Thornton were inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in Toronto over the weekend.
Chara received his Hall of Fame ring on Saturday, ahead of the formal induction ceremony on Monday.
Chara's career accolades include a 2011 Stanley Cup win, seven All-Star selections, and a 2009 Norris Trophy.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox likely active in MLB free agency, with $219 million payroll, $25 million below first luxury tax threshold.
Red Sox predicted as favorites to re-sign Alex Bregman and are contenders for Kyle Schwarber, Pete Alonso signings.
Boston is among possible destinations for pitchers Dylan Cease and Framber Valdez, enhancing their rotation options.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, 2025, marking 20 years since his debut album.
Legend's performance included hits from his album 'Get Lifted' and covers from artists like Kanye West and Alicia Keys.
The concert setlist featured songs like 'Prelude,' 'Used To Love U,' 'All Of Me,' and a medley of various covers.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officials after Celtics' 123-110 loss to Magic, hinting at missed calls affecting his performance.
Following a previous loss to the Jazz, Brown directly criticized refs for not calling a crucial foul on Keyonte George.
Despite his complaints, Brown was not fined by the league for his comments after the loss to the Jazz.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Baker Mayfield, Buccaneers' quarterback, has completed 63.9% of passes for 1,919 yards, 13 touchdowns, and two interceptions with a 98.1 passer rating.
Buccaneers rookie Emeka Egbuka has 562 receiving yards and five touchdowns despite recent injuries impacting performance.
Buccaneers defense ranks seventh in defensive DVOA, with standouts Jamel Dean and Antoine Winfield Jr. leading secondary efforts.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo to call Patriots-Buccaneers game, their first Patriots broadcast since 2023.
Nantz and Romo's assignment signals renewed relevance for Patriots, now led by QB Drake Maye.
Nantz looks forward to calling Maye's game, having known the quarterback for several years.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Magic defeat Celtics 123-110, marking Boston's first NBA Cup loss despite Jaylen Brown's 32 points.
Celtics struggle from three-point range while Magic hit 17 of 36, reversing typical Boston winning formula.
Payton Pritchard improves three-point shooting, finishing 5-for-8 and scoring 27 points against the Magic.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph faces public reprimand for creating an appearance of impropriety in a 2018 ICE incident.
Massachusetts officer Denis J. McInerney recommends reprimand despite finding no evidence Joseph authorized ICE evasion plan.
Federal charges in 2019 against Joseph were dropped in 2022 after agreeing to state agency misconduct investigation.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about the team's future despite losing to the Yankees in the playoffs.
Key lineup changes include Trevor Story opting into his contract and Alex Bregman opting out.
The team’s 89-73 record and postseason experience are viewed as steps forward despite roster uncertainties.
